erupt.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly
erupt.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Violence erupted after police shot a student during the demonstration.

erupt.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if a volcano erupts, it explodes and sends smoke, fire, and rock into the sky
erupt.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if a place or situation erupts, there is a sudden increase in activity or emotion
erupt.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: They were angry to the point of erupting into riot.
Their conversations often erupted into squabbles.
erupt.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if spots erupt on your body, they suddenly appear on your skin
